p: O’nyong’nyong virus (ONNV) is a closer CHIKV related alphavirus vectored mainly by the Anopheles mosquito. Its RNA was detected by RT-PCR from a pool of Anopheles mosquito collected in Kinshasa [ 13]. Serological evidence of ONNV has been recorded in buffaloes from the Garamba National Park and duikers from the Ituri Rain Forest [ 33]. O’nyong’nyong outbreaks in humans were reported in neighbouring Uganda and Tanzania in 1996 [ 40]. However, no human case of ONNV infection has been reported in DRC.
